meanings.definition: The development of events beyond a person's control, regarded as determined by a supernatural power.
meanings.sent1: Her fate was sealed when she missed the last bus home.
meanings.sent2: It is said that fate brought them together at the right time.
meanings.sent3: In a twist of fate, the cat ended up chasing the dog instead.
meanings.sent4: The fate of the lost city remained a mystery for centuries.
meanings.sent5: The ominous clouds signaled the fate of the upcoming storm.

meanings.definition: Be destined to happen, turn out, or act in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: He will fate to become a great leader one day.
meanings.sent2: The decision to move abroad seemed to fate well for her career.
meanings.sent3: The magician fated the cards to reveal the chosen one.
meanings.sent4: The old prophecy fated the kingdom to fall under a dark spell.
meanings.sent5: The wise elder fated that the young warrior would bring peace to the land.
